sub_title: Expert in Local Government Finance and Taxes
summary:
Served since 1993 as financial management expert, team-leader, trainer, mentor and advisor in the area of municipal finances and taxes in over 25 countries.

Europe:
Poland, Hungary, Latvia, Slovenia, Bulgaria, Romania, Moldova, Macedonia, Albania, Kosovo, Serbia, Bosnia, Belarus, Ukraine.

Africa and Asia:
South Africa, Botswana, Zimbabwe, Zambia, Tanzania, Uganda, Mozambique, Turkey, Syria, Nepal and Vietnam. 

Gained broad international experience in providing technical assistance and training in the field of fiscal policy formulation, (programme) budgeting, revenue collection, cash- and debt management, public private partnership and asset management.

Advised several Local Government Associations in Europe, Africa and Asia on Strategic Planning in relation to sustainable Financial Management.

Designed and implemented the first Cash- and Debt management system in Central and Eastern Europe, in the Polish Cities of Krakow and Gdansk. Introduced Programme Budgeting, on a pilot basis, in one Bulgarian and seven Serbian Municipalities. 

Gained extensive expertise during a long career in Arnhem Municipality as respectively:
- Economic Policy Advisor, 
- Head of Bureau for Capital Investment and Debt Management, 
- Adjunct Director of Finance/Adjunct Concern Controler, 
- Interim-Manager of the Department for Local Economic Development, 
- Interim Manager of the Municipal Auditing Agency ,
- Special Advisor to the Board of Mayor and Aldermen. 
Particular experienced in fiscal policy, budgeting, municipal taxes, cash- and debt management, risk management, local economic development, Public Private Partnership and privatisation
